skillTree.localised_description: The Fly Lord and his devotees despise Tzeentch, for his obsession with schemes and trickery are the polar opposite of Nurgle's delight in slow, musty stagnation.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Tzeentchian factions
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Tzeentchian factions

skillTree.localised_description: Attacking the Fly Lord's most faithful servants is made all the more difficult by the magical slime that slows enemy warriors and restricts their strikes.
Anything fired at this vile Nurglish servant's immense girth must penetrate many folds of sweaty fat before they even have the slightest chance of piercing his flesh.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +10% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +10% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +20% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +20% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +30% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A lifetime spent cataloguing the most vile of diseases has left its mark on the Tallyman, for a miasma of rot and pestilence surrounds him wherever he goes.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each nearby entity death.

skillTree.localised_description: Once a Plaguebearer, always a Plaguebearer. You can't fight nature.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +100% for Exalted Plaguebearers of Nurgle and Plague Drones of Nurgle (Death's Heads)
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -10% for Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Exalted Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Pox Riders and Plague Drones of Nurgle units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Exalted Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Pox Riders and Plague Drones of Nurgle units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Epidemius has brought a foetid seedling from the Garden of Blight to be cultivated in the mortal world.

effects.description:
Population surplus: 1 for newly-captured settlements
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Daemons are even more resistant to objects in the mortal realm than in their own dark dimensions.

effects.description:
Recruitment health: +5% for all Daemonic units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for all Daemons
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Tallyman has ascended further still, at last becoming the right-hand man of the Urfather Himself.

effects.description:
HIDDEN - (USED WHEN WE NEED TO SCOPE TO SETTLEMENTS AND FORCES WITHOUT SHOWING BOTH EFFECTS IN UI) Infection cost to create a Plague: -10%
	(own armies factionwide)
Plague immunity duration: -1 turns (for all future plagues)

Infection cost to create a Plague: -10%
	(all regions factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: The Tallyman's Blades are tied to the world, and therefore able to last for days on end in the mortal realm.

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Exalted Plaguebearers

skillTree.localised_description: Layers of rotten skin explode in a toxic cloud of decay, forcing the foe to stagger back in agony and disgust.

ui_effects.localised_text: Explosion does not affect friendly troops

skillTree.localised_description: Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, itâ€™s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
A foetid explosion of putrescence tears through the enemy ranks, pulverising the unwary and dousing them in eternal decay.

ui_effects.localised_text: Explosion does not affect friendly troops

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Imagine a rubbery, pus-filled bag lurching towards you. Now imagine it is travelling at twice its usual speed...

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +3 for Chaos Knights of Nurgle, Rot Knights, Chaos Chariots of Nurgle and Pox Rider units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Chaos Knights of Nurgle, Rot Knights, Chaos Chariots of Nurgle and Pox Rider units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +6 for Chaos Knights of Nurgle, Rot Knights, Chaos Chariots of Nurgle and Pox Rider units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Chaos Knights of Nurgle, Rot Knights, Chaos Chariots of Nurgle and Pox Rider units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +9 for Chaos Knights of Nurgle, Rot Knights, Chaos Chariots of Nurgle and Pox Rider units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Sensible enemies think at least twice before attacking such a diseased specimen, for even if they win, chances are they have caught something really nasty along the way.

effects.description:
Armour: +4 for Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Nurglings, Marauders of Nurgle, Pestigors, Chaos Warriors, Chosen and Forsaken of Nurgle units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +8 for Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Nurglings, Marauders of Nurgle, Pestigors, Chaos Warriors, Chosen and Forsaken of Nurgle units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Nurglings, Marauders of Nurgle, Pestigors, Chaos Warriors, Chosen and Forsaken of Nurgle units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +12 for Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Nurglings, Marauders of Nurgle, Pestigors, Chaos Warriors, Chosen and Forsaken of Nurgle units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Nurglings, Marauders of Nurgle, Pestigors, Chaos Warriors, Chosen and Forsaken of Nurgle units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Grandfather loves the smallest of his many children at least as much as his myriad other grim creations, if not more so.

effects.description:
Speed: +3% for Chaos Warhounds, Chaos Spawn of Nurgle, Plague Toads and Plague Ogre units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +5% for Chaos Warhounds, Chaos Spawn of Nurgle, Plague Toads and Plague Ogre units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 5% for Chaos Warhounds, Chaos Spawn of Nurgle, Plague Toads and Plague Ogre units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Chaos Warhounds, Chaos Spawn of Nurgle, Plague Toads and Plague Ogre units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Chaos Warhounds, Chaos Spawn of Nurgle, Plague Toads and Plague Ogre units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The flying things are beloved of Nurgle, for they are, oft-times, the method of infection for his most potent, hideous infirmities.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Rot Flies, Plague Drones and Chaos Fury units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Rot Flies, Plague Drones and Chaos Fury units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Rot Flies, Plague Drones and Chaos Fury units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +10% for Plague Drones of Nurgle (Death's Heads) units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Rot Flies, Plague Drones and Chaos Fury units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Rot Flies, Plague Drones and Chaos Fury units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for Plague Drones of Nurgle (Death's Heads) units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: None more foul. None more black. Yuk.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +4 for Great Unclean One, Chaos Warshrine of Nurgle, Beast of Nurgle, Bile Trolls, Toad Dragon and Soul Grinder of Nurgle units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Great Unclean One, Chaos Warshrine of Nurgle, Beast of Nurgle, Bile Trolls, Toad Dragon and Soul Grinder of Nurgle units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +8% for Great Unclean One, Chaos Warshrine of Nurgle, Beast of Nurgle, Bile Trolls, Toad Dragon and Soul Grinder of Nurgle units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Great Unclean One, Chaos Warshrine of Nurgle, Beast of Nurgle, Bile Trolls, Toad Dragon and Soul Grinder of Nurgle units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Great Unclean One, Chaos Warshrine of Nurgle, Beast of Nurgle, Bile Trolls, Toad Dragon and Soul Grinder of Nurgle units
	(Lord's army)

ui_effects.localised_text: Will spread to enemies within the Spread Range metres of affected unit

skillTree.localised_description: A poisonous malady so hideous, even death is no escape.

effects.description:
Speed: +15% for Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Nurglings, Marauders of Nurgle, Pestigors, Chaos Warriors, Chosen and Forsaken of Nurgle units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Nurglings, Marauders of Nurgle, Pestigors, Chaos Warriors, Chosen and Forsaken of Nurgle units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Nurglings, Marauders of Nurgle, Pestigors, Chaos Warriors, Chosen and Forsaken of Nurgle units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The corrosive ooze emanating from the most ulcerous sores is one of the most effective weapons in the Urfather's foul armoury.

effects.description:
Speed: +10% Marauder Horsemen of Nurgle (Throwing Axes), Chaos Knights of Nurgle, Rot Knights, Chaos Chariots of Nurgle and Pox Rider units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 Marauder Horsemen of Nurgle (Throwing Axes), Chaos Knights of Nurgle, Rot Knights, Chaos Chariots of Nurgle and Pox Rider units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% Marauder Horsemen of Nurgle (Throwing Axes), Chaos Knights of Nurgle, Rot Knights, Chaos Chariots of Nurgle and Pox Rider units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The air most creatures breathe provides just another avenue of attack for Nurgle and his many and varied contagions.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Chaos Furies, Rot Flies, Plague Drones of Nurgle, Chaos Warhounds, Chaos Spawn of Nurgle, Plague Toads and Plague Ogres (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Chaos Furies, Rot Flies, Plague Drones of Nurgle, Chaos Warhounds, Chaos Spawn of Nurgle, Plague Toads and Plague Ogres (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Chaos Furies, Rot Flies, Plague Drones of Nurgle, Chaos Warhounds, Chaos Spawn of Nurgle, Plague Toads and Plague Ogres (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Blade and point and spell can be turned aside very easily by the Fly Lord's most-favoured servants.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Great Unclean One, Chaos Warshrine of Nurgle, Beast of Nurgle, Bile Trolls, Toad Dragon and Soul Grinder of Nurgle units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Great Unclean One, Chaos Warshrine of Nurgle, Beast of Nurgle, Bile Trolls, Toad Dragon and Soul Grinder of Nurgle units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: 5% for Great Unclean One, Chaos Warshrine of Nurgle, Beast of Nurgle, Bile Trolls, Toad Dragon and Soul Grinder of Nurgle units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Sulphurous, acerbic disease is no respecter of rank, nobility or prowess in battle; all shall fall afore Nurgle's filthy infections.

ui_effects.localised_text: Will spread to enemies within the Spread Range metres of affected unit

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
Just as all life is born, so it must wither and die. Before that happens comes disease, in all its disgusting, filth-ridden glory.
With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption â€“ as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.

effects.description:
All other types of corruption: -1
	(local province)

All other types of corruption: -2
	(local province)

All other types of corruption: -3
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
Battles can be lost, but can the war ever really be won? The advance of Ruin can never truly be halted once and for all.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those corrupted by Nurgle's rot flock to his putrid banner in the hope that they will be reborn anew in Grandfather's image.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

Daemonic units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is low.
	
	Daemonic units also have:
	Physical Resistance
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

factionEffects.localised_description: From casualty and infection rates to skin reactions and colorations, all such information is incredibly valuable to Father Nurgle, proliferated and recorded by His eminent Tallyman with absolute precision.

effects.description: Gains powerful rewards based on number of Plagues on non-Nurgle factions
Cycle time: -1 for Plagueflesh Poppies buildings
Recruit rank: +2 for Plaguebearers of Nurgle and Exalted Plaguebearers of Nurgle units
Campaign movement range: +25% for Plague Cultists

items.colour_text: Sometimes the pen is mightier than the sword, but in the case of the Tallyman, the two are equally dangerous.

item_set.name: Rotten Articles
item_set.description: These icons of filth further empower the Tallyman as he does the Fly Lord's foul bidding.

items.colour_text: As the sands of time slip through the hourglass, decay embraces all, reminding us of the eternal cycle of life and death, and the omnipresent touch of Nurgle's rot.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +15 with Daemons of Chaos

ui_effects.localised_text: Enemy units within the Spread Range will receive negative effects
Friendly units within the Spread Range will receive positive effects

item_set.name: Rotten Articles
item_set.description: These icons of filth further empower the Tallyman as he does the Fly Lord's foul bidding.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The chosen Tallyman of Nurgle is a sight to behold for all the Urfather's followers, his evergrowing paperwork illustrating the Fly Lord's power.

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Exalted Plaguebearers

effects.description: Passive ability: "Regeneration" when fighting against an enemy with a Plague

Melee attack: +5 when fighting against an enemy with a Plague
	(Lord's army)
